page.title: 19Parish Church of W Kingsdown
page.content:
The{Church of Edmund, Saint and Martyr is picturesquely set in a clearing in woodland, with a{well-tended burial {ground.} The churchyard is entered by a very heavy and not particularly ancient{lych-gate}of{Victorian}origin.
The church itself is{small,}reflecting the size and wealth of its congregation until recent times. {Norman}in origin, there are still signs of the early church visible in the fabric of the building today. Unusually the{tower}is on the{south side of the church. In one of the window arches can be seen traces of very old{wall paintings.
The church is kept locked when not in use, but has a{viewing panel}in the {west door}to permit the visitor to see some of the beauty of the interior.
